Posts.Content: Good morning ladies...... I am fairly new here but already feel so welcomed. I feel safe to say something silly, cos it could be just the worry bug. I had my lumpectomy 2 weeks ago and one node which had some cancer cells in it, only specualtion if the other do! I need to return to have some more tissue removed but waiting on a CT scan appointment coming through! worry worry incase my her2 cancer spreads while I sit and wait.......   This morning I woke to the room spinning of course when I move a wave of nausea hits me.... its been 5hrs now and feel no better.... and no I have not been drinking LOL! if I had I would put in down to self inflection  :)))) huge hugs Nain xx
Posts.Title: spining room and nausea

Posts.Content: thank you Irene54, there is always something these days isn't ther and sometimes so difficult to think rationally. no new meds so you maybe right about ther inner ear thingy, not usually one to make a fuss, then again I am not mty ususal self some of the time..... LOL! Huge Hugs hope alls well with you Nain xx
Posts.Title: spining room and nausea

Posts.Content: thats not right leaving someone that long, what are these medical people on....spectulating and telling you bad news without test results! rediculous...... the unkown is always the worst and the worry bug takes hold and dominates the thoughts, day and  I feel the night time is the worst time, especially 3am when psychologically you know you can't go waking folk up for a chat.    I was diagonosed, biopsy, lumpectomy all with in 4 weeks, on saying that the test showed cancer in the lymph nodes and i need another lumpectomy to take more tissue...... and I have to wait for a scan date, they were talking on a cancellation being my best bet for a early appointment. worry worry, but I try hard to take one day at a time. Its pointless telling you not to worry shawahank.... cos it only natural..... but do try sweetie....LOL! huge hugs always Nain xxx
Posts.Title: still waitin

Posts.Content: hello shawahank, I was the same !!   a routine mammagram 3 weeks ago and BANG..... i am going to see the surgeon this morning about the op....... its so scary is'nt it the  not knowing !  Hope you hear soon. Take Care Nain x
Posts.Title: first appointment

Posts.Content: hope you are feeling better today...... I am booked in for a lumpectomy sugery on Tuesday 4th sept, thye type of cancer will need rad and chemo treatment..... now anxiety is seeping in as the shell shock feeling is wearing off.  You take and do keep me update of your progress, sending  hugs .....  Nain  xxx
Posts.Title: first appointment

Posts.Content: Hello Mother47 Your story sounds rather like my experience with Docetaxel. I have had 3 now and each one, I was having problems with my thinking progress. After speaking to the oncologist about my concerns we identified the main factor was the steriods I had to take the day before, day of, day after. I found  that ginger beer was helpful with the thick and sore tongue, before the treatment I hated the taste of ginger beer, now its a life line LOL!doc Wishing you well with your treatment. Jean (Nain)
Posts.Title: First Docetaxel

Posts.Content: thanks you ladies, your lovely  posts brought the first smile since yesterdays news. Hope today is a good day for you.  Its so good to talk and share Huge thanks Nain xx
Posts.Title: we can spread the word, it's good to talk

Posts.Content: Hi ladies, Standing at yet another bridge, the hospital phone yesterday with appointment this morning for a Bone scan and a CT Monday morning. Just a tad nervousand trying hard to follow my own advice, one day at a time.... LOL!  I failed the advice of others and googled bone scans as I have never heard of anyone I know have one.... now wish I had'nt. my postivity has winggled ..... After a horrid nightmare leaving me feeling a little low, but  susy post about things people say before they have engaged their brain, as brought a little smile to the grim day. There is always a ray of sunshine here when you need it most !! Huge hugs Nain xx
Posts.Title: Bone and CT scans

Posts.Content: Hi ladies, thanks for all you love and support, it  sure does makes the journery easier ! Its not the test that make me nevous... its more of the waiting and what they reveal ! The bone scan was easy peasy ... two parts, in the morning they injected radio active chemicals through the arm and then had to return again 3 hrs later for the scan. A part from a slight vibration from the bed I had a doze for 20 mins ! one day at a time !!  its friday so a glass of champers and a dvd is on the card with my lovely hubby. Hope everyone has a fab weekend. Huge Hugs Nain
Posts.Title: Bone and CT scans

Posts.Content: Hello Ankah, welcome to the group we hope no ones has to join, but alas we do, I was diagonosed just 5 weeks ago already had a lumpectomy after a routine mamogram. More scans another op chemo and rads ahead of me.........  Like you now !!  the shock has worn off. I just live from day to day.... try hard not to build scenarios in my head..... deal with each challenge as they arrive..... cross each bridge when they appear. There are many lovely ladies here much further on than us and are wonderful sharing their early times and giving everyone  support, especially on the days the glue that holds us together  becomes unstuck !!  :) All the best with the treatment ahead. Huge Hugs Nain x
Posts.Title: Newgirl

Posts.Content: Hi Mandy, my heart goes out to you, its one of those really difficult days, we all get them. Cant you just curl up and go to sleep for a while ? I know its hard when there is a 2year to look after..... . Buts shes not just your resposibilty..... thats why we have friends and family.  We all look after each other in times of need. I have HER2 Positive, 27mm grade 3, hopefully I will start chemo next week, 3 FEC, 3 DOC and 15 sessions of rads. The last few days have been bad, so today my eyes see the mess of the house.... but to hell with it I come first at the moment. ( and I never thought i would ever say that LOL! ) I looked after my mum full time last year as she went through cancer, the chemo wiped her out and she felt low which was not her usually happy self. She rested alot, on the good days we went for short walks, she did a little round the house.other days she rested.  Just for today....  is my motto !! Everyone is different, please look after your self, I know is easier to say than do , be a little selfness sometimes. All the work will be there ! if other people are worried they can just do it :P Tomorrow is another day, lets hope its a better day for you. Take Care.... Huge Hugs Jean x
Posts.Title: 1st fec

Posts.Content: i know Julie is so difficult is'nt it ! , i was only diagnosed last week, I think i am still shell shocked with the news.   I am sorry to hear that you constantly stuggle with those annoying little negative thoughts that pop up making like hard for you. Hope things get easier for you soon best wishes nain
Posts.Title: Living again

Posts.Content: thank you KatieG for your positive message, i am pleased to hear your journey is getting easier than the begining, you have given me so much support on my first day here. thank you As my journey is just begins......... ... Best wishes Nain
Posts.Title: Living again

Posts.Content: Hi Sue, welcome to the club. we all support each other here. I had a lumpectomy and one node removed a couple of months ago, and last week a second op to take some more tissue to make the margins bigger. I get the results tomorrow, either its Plan A or Plan B. Like the other ladies say mention it to your onc, to talk through your worries. If they were worried at all, they would have sent you for a bone scan, mine came back all clear, so I know the chest pains and the aching upper arm and back pain are just side effects. My BCN, did say the pains maybe a result of things settling down from the operations. There is always some worry with any aches or pains, as we are on high alert these days ! theres no harm in asking again Sue. Take Care and all the best for tomorrow. Huge Hugs Nain xx
Posts.Title: Possible bone mets but nobody listening to me!

Posts.Content: Hey winston, Wow! what a busy day, glad you fitted in a good fed, keep your strengh up for the road ahead. Sent you a PM. Take care Hugs Nain xx
Posts.Title: "On A Light-Hearted Note ........"

Posts.Content: Hey, Samm99,  winston kateG, Shazbo, saxxyD, irene54, LM Thanks for your comments and sharing your experieces..... its great to beable to come here to share the thoughts bombing about in the brain....I am defo in my thoughts now. Think I will keep them ! Another little step forward .... Big hugs to all and hope all goes well with each of you. huge thanks xxx
Posts.Title: Remove or Not Remove Underarm Lymph Nodes

Posts.Content: thanks for the evonail tip Carol.... I love my nails and now I am resting lotsmore they have had a chance to long longer... happy happy. !   I have found a website Farmaline, based in Belgium they had some in stock for around £27.31 including postage well worth it ...... Huge Hugs xx
Posts.Title: The wonders of evonail - day 13 no nail damage

Posts.Content: hi congenial..... every reply reply and story are vaild, thats whats so good here.... you can ask anything and no one thinks silly girl.... I also agree theres no problems... just challenges! Thanks xx
Posts.Title: Remove or Not Remove Underarm Lymph Nodes

Posts.Content: hi everyone..... The results from the Lumpectomy were not so great.... I need further breast surgery and been asked to think about a clearance of the lumph nodes. They only took one node which had a speck of cancer, its only speculation whither anymore are affected. Does anyone have any thoughts if clearance is best or just have go ahead without removing anymore.....  as chemo  would kill any lurking cancer if any! My feelings are mixed, but I edge on the side of no surgery and keep them..... what do others think...... Love and hugs Nain x
Posts.Title: Remove or Not Remove Underarm Lymph Nodes

Posts.Content: I came up with other sites too Sarah .... the US amazon wanted over $50 dollars. as you say a bit pricey...... but at the end of the day  hopefully it will prove a valuable item in our BC first aid care bag. Huge Hugs xx
Posts.Title: The wonders of evonail - day 13 no nail damage
